alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:22PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Moffat and eastern Uintah Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 422 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles north of Dinosaur, or 29 miles east of Vernal, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Moffat and eastern Uintah Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains
